sources.title: "The Road to Ruin" (1928)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "The Road to Ruin" is a poignant social drama. This film illustrates the work of Florence Turner, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. A teenage girl lacking parental guidance and control loses her way in life.   Directed by               Norton S. Parker Produced by             Cliff Broughton Productions Based on                    a screen story by Willis Kent Starring                     Helen Foster, Grant Withers, Florence Turner, Charles Miller Cinematography        Henry Cronjager Editing by                  Edith Wakeling Distributed by           Cliff Broughton Productions Release date               March 23, 1928 Running time             56 min. metadata.Plot: A controversial, low-budget drama about the life of a young teenage girl that goes on the "road to ruin." Sally is a 16-year-old New York City teen who, neglected by her parents, takes up smoking and drinking, engages in affairs with a series of older men, gets arrested by the police during a strip poker game, is sent home only to discover later that she's pregnant, and after getting an illegal abortion, the words "The Wages of Sin is Death" inexpliably appear over her bed in fire.
metadata.Actors: Helen Foster, Virginia Roye, Grant Withers
